content:
• Tuesday, October 25, 2011
  • ATGE

    Shares of for-profit education company DeVry (DV) took hit after hours as its FQ1 earnings...

    Shares of for-profit education company DeVry (DV) took hit after hours as its FQ1 earnings missed the mark. Profits fell 22% Y/Y, hit by a weak enrollment in its main unit - business, technology and management - plus higher operating costs. For-profit college enrollments have suffered after being forced to rein in aggressive recruiting practices amid criticism of their high student-loan default rates. Shares -8.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • IRBT

    IRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) rises 4.6% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $120.4M (+28% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    IRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) rises 4.6% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $120.4M (+28% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.38 (exc. $0.12 tax benefit), beating consensus by $1.3M and $0.24. Growth was driven by a 51% increase in international home robot sales. The company expects Q4 revenue of $130M-$135M and EPS of $0.26-$0.30, compared with a consensus of $132.9M and $0.29.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • MET

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) is tumbling after the Fed rejects the company's plan to resume its stock...

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) is tumbling after the Fed rejects the company's plan to resume its stock repurchase program and boost the dividend. The Fed says these actions need to be "tested under a revised adverse macroeconomic scenario." Shares -4.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCK

    McKesson (NYSE:MCK) is now up 3.8% AH after beating Q3 forecasts. The company's performance was...

    McKesson (NYSE:MCK) is now up 3.8% AH after beating Q3 forecasts. The company's performance was driven by 10% Y/Y growth in its pharmacy distribution business, and 7% growth in its Technology Solutions business. McKesson is guiding for FY12 EPS of $6.19-$6.39, compared with a consensus of $6.23. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • MAR

    Marriott's (NYSE:MAR) board approves the spin-off of its timeshare business - Marriott Vacations...

    Marriott's (NYSE:MAR) board approves the spin-off of its timeshare business - Marriott Vacations Worldwide - through the distribution of shares to existing stockholders. MAR +1.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • MASI

    Masimo (NASDAQ:MASI), a maker of patient monitoring systems, gains 2.1% AH in spite of reporting...

    Masimo (NASDAQ:MASI), a maker of patient monitoring systems, gains 2.1% AH in spite of reporting Q3 revenue of $104M (+3 % Y/Y) and EPS $0.24, missing consensus by $5.7M and $0.03. Masimo is also lowering its 2011 EPS guidance to $1.04-$1.06, from a prior range of $1.17-$1.25.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • FFIV

    More on F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): Q3 beats estimates on a 24% jump in Y/Y revenue, fueled by...

    More on F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): Q3 beats estimates on a 24% jump in Y/Y revenue, fueled by rising sales in Japan and the Asia Pacific region. Product sales, which make up a majority of the company's business, were up 20%, an increase the company said in part reflected strong demand for its new mid-range Viprion 2400 and 4400, which exceeded expectations. Shares +8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    With operating income of $79M on sales of $10.9B, Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) has a profit margin of...

    With operating income of $79M on sales of $10.9B, Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) has a profit margin of 0.7% vs. 3.5% a year ago. "At what point do profits matter more than revenue growth," asks a trader. Amazon will have 1% operating margins on the Kindle Fire and that will improve their overall number. Shares -14% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • PNRA

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA) is trading up after hours as its Q3 easily beats estimates. Earnings...

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA) is trading up after hours as its Q3 easily beats estimates. Earnings leapt 27% on higher sales and better operating margins, with revenue and same-store sales growth all beating projections. The company also raises its FY11 EPS outlook for the year to $4.63 - $4.65 per share, and ups growth estimates to 4.5% - 5%. Shares +10% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMZN

    More on Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Q3: Expects Q4 '11 operating income between -$200M and $250M -...

    More on Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Q3: Expects Q4 '11 operating income between -$200M and $250M - top of range represents 47% Y/Y decline. North American and International sales both +44% Y/Y. Media sales +24% Y/Y, sales of "electronics & other general merchandise" +54%. Free cash flow of $268M, down from $540M in year-ago period. AMZN -14% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • ESRX

    More on Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX): Q3 beats across the board on a 143% Y/Y jump in cash flow...

    More on Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX): Q3 beats across the board on a 143% Y/Y jump in cash flow and a 7% Y/Y boost in gross profit. The Company reaffirms FY11 guidance of between $2.95 - $3.05 per share. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR): EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.62B (+51% Y/Y) beats by...

    Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR): EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.62B (+51% Y/Y) beats by $102M. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM): Q3 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.96B (+ 8% Y/Y) beats by $10M....

    Broadcom (BRCM): Q3 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.96B (+ 8% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Expects Q4 revenue of $1.7B-$1.8B, below a $2.01B consensus. BRCM -5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN): Q3 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $10.88B (+ 44% Y/Y) misses...

    Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN): Q3 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $10.88B (+ 44% Y/Y) misses by $50M. Expects Q4 revenue of $16.45B-$18.65B vs. $18.1B consensus. AMZN -15.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • NFLX

    The day's biggest loser? No, not Neflix (NFLX -34.3%). it's Healthways (HWAY -44%), which...

    The day's biggest loser? No, not Neflix (NFLX -34.3%)... it's Healthways (HWAY -44%), which posts its worst-ever share price loss after disclosing its top customer, Cigna (NYSE:CI), will allow its contract with the company to wind down ahead of expiration. The Cigna loss, while hitting revenues only by 15%, impacts earnings by up to 60%, Piper Jaffray says, seeing no EPS growth for two years.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • ARMH

    ARM (ARMH +1%) outperforms after delivering a strong Q3 report. Results were boosted by the...

    ARM (ARMH +1%) outperforms after delivering a strong Q3 report. Results were boosted by the signing of 23 licensing deals for ARM's Cortex processor cores (up from 21 in Q2), which carry higher royalty rates, and a 19% Y/Y increase in royalty revenue (compared with 1% growth in chip industry revenues). (.pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • FN

    Optical networking stocks sink as investors come to grips with the significant damage from...

    Optical networking stocks sink as investors come to grips with the significant damage from flooding in Thailand to facilities operated by Fabrinet (FN -21.8%), whose key customers read like a who’s who in the sector: JDS Uniphase (JDSU -8.2%), Oclaro (OCLR -8.1%), Opnext (OPXT -18.4%), Finisar (FNSR -2%), Emcore (EMKR -10.8%). (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • TWIN

    Twin Disc (NASDAQ:TWIN), a maker of power transmission gear for transportation systems, gains...

    Twin Disc (NASDAQ:TWIN), a maker of power transmission gear for transportation systems, gains 22.2% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $81.3M (+32% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.83, beating Street estimates by $2.4M and $0.38. Gross margin increased 520 bps Y/Y to 37.8%, and the company's 6-month backlog grew 12% Q/Q, to $164.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • STP

    Nomura adds weight to the downdraft in solar stocks this afternoon after it lowers its rating on...

    Nomura adds weight to the downdraft in solar stocks this afternoon after it lowers its rating on the sector, citing a lack of near-term catalysts, demand headwinds and weakening earnings momentum. The firm cuts the following: Suntech Power (STP -5.3%), Trina Solar (TSL -5.7%) and Yingli Green Energy (YGE -3.6%) are all reduced to Neutral, and LDK Solar (LDK -3.9%) is downgraded to Reduce.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • AKS

    Q3 reports from major steel players AKS Steel (AKS -13.4%) and U.S. Steel (X -8.3%) (I, II) -...

    Q3 reports from major steel players AKS Steel (AKS -13.4%) and U.S. Steel (X -8.3%) (I, II) - replete with warnings - sweep over the sector taking a bevvy of steel companies lower. KeyBanc's Mark Parr believes the companies are calling out lower-than-expected Q4 earnings with their statements. Decliners: STLD -2.5%, CMC -4%, MT -3.1%, ATI -5.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -21.7%) has lost nearly a fifth of its value since announcing this afternoon...

    First Solar (FSLR -21.7%) has lost nearly a fifth of its value since announcing this afternoon CEO Rob Gillette is out. All in all, it's a stunning drop considering Gillette only joined the company in Oct. '09, and interim CEO Michael Ahearn ran the show for the prior 9 years. First Solar's news is adding to broader weakness in solar stocks (KWT -6.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • FSLR

    Citigroup comments on First Solar (FSLR -20%), saying the company may have to run factories...

    Citigroup comments on First Solar (FSLR -20%), saying the company may have to run factories below full utilization for the next few quarters, resulting in layoffs of up to 10% of its workforce. The firm says customers are pushing back on prior contracts and insisting on lower module pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • TTWO

    Shares of Take-Two Interactive (NASDAQ:TTWO) leap 7.2% as investors latch on to the firm's...

    Shares of Take-Two Interactive (NASDAQ:TTWO) leap 7.2% as investors latch on to the firm's prospects to boost sales with the next release of Grand Theft Auto - now officially waiting in the wings for a 2012 release (trailer). Analysts note the GTA franchise tends to have "long legs" with customers, setting sales targets as high as 20M units for the highly-anticipated game.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • DAL

    Soothing words from Delta (DAL -5.1%) CEO Ed Bastian that corporate bookings are up Y/Y and...

    Soothing words from Delta (DAL -5.1%) CEO Ed Bastian that corporate bookings are up Y/Y and continue to look "very strong" aren't preventing a selloff in Delta and other airlines (XAL -3%) today. "There is a misconnect between the headlines and what corporate travel is actually doing and thinking about at the moment," a CRT Capital analyst says. (earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • MLI

    Shares of copper tube and fittings manufacturer Mueller Industries (MLI -17%) get hammered after...

    Shares of copper tube and fittings manufacturer Mueller Industries (MLI -17%) get hammered after its Q3 missed estimates. Net income tumbled to $10.5M from $18.9M the prior year as the company's bottom line was hit by volatile copper prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • WLTW

    Willis Group (WSH -7.8%) tanks after reporting revenue of $762M (+4% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.34,...

    Willis Group (WSH -7.8%) tanks after reporting revenue of $762M (+4% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.34, missing Street forecasts by $2.2M and $0.03. The company is also lowering its 2011 EPS guidance to $2.70-$2.80 ($2.87 consensus), citing weakness in its Loan Protector division, which provides insurance for the mortgage servicing industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • VLTR

    Volterra (VLTR -3.6%) is off its morning lows, but still underperforming after reporting Q3...

    Volterra (VLTR -3.6%) is off its morning lows, but still underperforming after reporting Q3 revenue of $41.3M (-1% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.35; the latter beat consensus by $0.03, but the former missed by $1.8M. Rival analog chipmaker Monolithic Power (MPWR -2.6%) is also selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • ITW

    Illinois Tool Works' (ITW -4.5%) Q3 beat on a per share basis as earnings rose 20% on strong...

    Illinois Tool Works' (ITW -4.5%) Q3 beat on a per share basis as earnings rose 20% on strong demand, but the shares are trading lower after the company cuts its outlook for the rest of the year due to restructuring costs. It now expects its EPS to be in the range between $0.86 - $0.94.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • LII

    Lennox (LII +8.6%) moves higher after its Q3 report beat estimates, despite a 19% decline in Y/Y...

    Lennox (LII +8.6%) moves higher after its Q3 report beat estimates, despite a 19% decline in Y/Y profit. Higher commodity costs hit margins and offset top-line growth, but not enough to impact already reduced expectations. The company also cuts its FY11 revenue growth outlook from 8% -11% to 7% -9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • HFC

    Oil refiners tank as crude oil futures move higher amid tightening inventories: HollyFrontier...

    Oil refiners tank as crude oil futures move higher amid tightening inventories: HollyFrontier (HFC -12.8%), Marathon Petroleum (MPC -8%) and Valero Energy (VLO -6.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • TLAB

    Tellabs (TLAB -5.9%) falls after missing Q3 revenue estimates, and guiding for Q4 revenue of...

    Tellabs (TLAB -5.9%) falls after missing Q3 revenue estimates, and guiding for Q4 revenue of just $300M-$330M ($349.9M consensus). Rival Ciena (CIEN -10.5%), whose beta is more than 3x as large, is selling off even harder. Other optical networking names trading lower: JDSU -8.6%. ALU -3.2%. CALX -4.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -10.4%) is getting hit after announcing that CEO Rob Gillette is stepping...

    First Solar (FSLR -10.4%) is getting hit after announcing that CEO Rob Gillette is stepping down. The company names Chairman and founder Michael Ahearn to serve as interim CEO effective immediately.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • PVH

    Warnaco (WRC -2.3%) dips after Wells Fargo lowers the shares to Market Perform, citing an...

    Warnaco (WRC -2.3%) dips after Wells Fargo lowers the shares to Market Perform, citing an uncertain global macro environment and concern that women's jeanswear weakness could continue into the second half of 2011.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (TXN -1.8%) is holding up well considering the magnitude of the guidance cut...

    Texas Instruments (TXN -1.8%) is holding up well considering the magnitude of the guidance cut attached to its Q3 report. Investors appear to be concurring with Kaufman Bros., which sees TI and other analog chipmakers as being in a "cyclical bottoming process." Many of TI's analog peers, such as LLTC, ADI, and MXIM, are up modestly. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • FRX

    Forest Laboratories (FRX -2%) trades lower after Argus cut the shares to Hold from Buy, saying...

    Forest Laboratories (FRX -2%) trades lower after Argus cut the shares to Hold from Buy, saying the expiration of its patents pose a risk to earnings going forward.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • ETH

    Shares of Ethan Allen Interiors (NYSE:ETH) poke out a 3.3% gain after the furniture maker...

    Shares of Ethan Allen Interiors (NYSE:ETH) poke out a 3.3% gain after the furniture maker records a $0.07 earnings beat on FQ1 revenue of $185M (+12% Y/Y). The company says written orders booked improved 13.2% from last year's comparable period.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • AUO

    AU Optronics (AUO -3.9%) trades lower after its Q3 missed the mark due to sluggish television...

    AU Optronics (AUO -3.9%) trades lower after its Q3 missed the mark due to sluggish television demand and a stronger yen. The company also expects weak order flow in Q4 as well, saying ongoing macroeconomic uncertainties are likely to weigh on consumer demand. It lowers its capital spending target - for the second time this year - to NT$60B.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • CARB

    Carbonite (NASDAQ:CARB) falls 9.7%, outpacing other cloud-related stocks to the downside as...

    Carbonite (NASDAQ:CARB) falls 9.7%, outpacing other cloud-related stocks to the downside as cloud M&A chatter starts to subside. Shares bounced off of a threshold of just above $14 that's been tricky to hold ever since the company's post-IPO runup in August.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • PCAR

    Kenworth and Peterbilt truck maker Paccar (PCAR +0.6%) posts a solid Q3, easily beating revenue...

    Kenworth and Peterbilt truck maker Paccar (PCAR +0.6%) posts a solid Q3, easily beating revenue and per share estimates. Earnings more than doubled Y/Y on sharply higher truck sales and improved performance at its finance unit. Geographically, sales soared over 80% Y/Y in North America and 64% in Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • INN

    Shares of Summit Hotel Properties (NYSE:INN) fall off 3.6% after pricing a 2M share public...

    Shares of Summit Hotel Properties (NYSE:INN) fall off 3.6% after pricing a 2M share public offering of its 9.25% Series A Preferred stock at a $25 per share. The company expects to haul in $48M in net proceeds from the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • NVS

    Novartis (NVS -3.9%) says it will cut about 1% of its workers and shutter three plants in...

    Novartis (NVS -3.9%) says it will cut about 1% of its workers and shutter three plants in Europe. The cuts will total about 2,000 jobs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • WDR

    Financial planner Waddell & Reed (WDR -5.8%) is lower today after its Q3 misses estimates,...

    Financial planner Waddell & Reed (WDR -5.8%) is lower today after its Q3 misses estimates, primarily due to changes in its tax rate and higher capital expenditures during the quarter. Overall sales increased 38% Y/Y, but total net inflows were down 23% from the same period last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • HUBG

    Shares of shipping services provider Hub Group (HUBG -11.4%) plunge as Q3 EPS comes in short of...

    Shares of shipping services provider Hub Group (HUBG -11.4%) plunge as Q3 EPS comes in short of analyst expectations, despite a 59% jump in revenue helped by higher volume and rates in its intermodal business. Results were hurt by higher transportation costs. Shares are downgraded at Wells Fargo, Stifel Nicolaus and Robert W. Baird.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • ADVS

    Shares of Advent Software (NASDAQ:ADVS), up 8.1%, march forward after the firm records a profit...

    Shares of Advent Software (NASDAQ:ADVS), up 8.1%, march forward after the firm records a profit and revenue beat with its Q3 report. The software company expects Q4 revenue of $84M-$86M, boosting full-year revenue to $324M-$326M - topping the consensus estimate of analysts of $322M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -7.6%) is selling off again as investors abandon the risk trade, but...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -7.6%) is selling off again as investors abandon the risk trade, but Canaccord's Scott Van Winkle remains quite bullish. Van Winkle is dismissive of new competition from Rogers Family, and believes single-serve brewers will eventually claim at least 40-50% of the home coffee market. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • GLD

    Gold spikes higher over the past 90 minutes, threatening to push past $1,700/oz. for the first...

    Gold spikes higher over the past 90 minutes, threatening to push past $1,700/oz. for the first time since it plummeted under that level in September. There's no particular news other than the continuing idea that Western governments have little choice but to continue bailing, which has to be good for the metal. Dec. Gold is at $1,694. GLD +2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 5 Comments
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK -5.5%) trades lower after its Q3 EPS misses forecasts, with the company blaming...

    Lexmark (LXK -5.5%) trades lower after its Q3 EPS misses forecasts, with the company blaming much of the shortfall on "discrete tax items." Lexmark is guiding for Q4 EPS of $1.15-$1.25, above a $1.12 consensus, though its forecast for a "mid-single digit range" Y/Y revenue decline is at best in-line with a consensus for a 4.3% decline.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming (BYD +3.3%) bucks a weak tape after its Q3 marginally beat estimates, but showed an...

    Boyd Gaming (BYD +3.3%) bucks a weak tape after its Q3 marginally beat estimates, but showed an improvement in its bottom line. Earnings dropped 44% as the casino operator again reported slightly weaker revenue, but EBITDA growth was postitive for a third straight quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • SQNS

    Sequans (SQNS -4.2%) trades lower after reporting Q3 revenue of $26.2M (+39% Y/Y, but -14% Q/Q)...

    Sequans (SQNS -4.2%) trades lower after reporting Q3 revenue of $26.2M (+39% Y/Y, but -14% Q/Q) and EPS of $0.08; the former was in-line with guidance, while the latter beat. The company is guiding for Q4 revenue to decline to $20M-$23M, and EPS to be in a range of -$0.05 to -$0.01. UBS remains bullish on expectations of a 2012 4G LTE chip ramp.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL -6%) dips after Piper Jaffray lowers the shares to Neutral. Piper says declining...

    ReneSola (SOL -6%) dips after Piper Jaffray lowers the shares to Neutral. Piper says declining wafer prices are negatively impacting the company's margins, and will likely lead to lowered estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • AAN

    Shares of Aaron's (NYSE:AAN), down 7%, lose traction after missing Q3 EPS estimates by $0.02 and...

    Shares of Aaron's (NYSE:AAN), down 7%, lose traction after missing Q3 EPS estimates by $0.02 and offering lukewarm guidance. Though revenue increased 7% Y/Y to $485M - led by a 5.3% gain in same-store sales and a 6.3% jump in same-store customer counts - the company concedes its customers are getting hit by high unemployment and overall economic pressure. Following the report, BB&T downgraded Aaron's to a Hold rating from Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • ININ

    Interactive Intelligence (NASDAQ:ININ), a provider of voice-over-IP software for call centers,...

    Interactive Intelligence (NASDAQ:ININ), a provider of voice-over-IP software for call centers, falls 21.7% after reporting Q3 revenue of $52.1M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.29, missing consensus by $1.4M and $0.02. The company blames the shortfall on the revenue recognition time for cloud software sales being longer than the recognition time for traditional software sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • FN

    Fabrinet (FN -11%) trades lower after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Hold, citing the impact...

    Fabrinet (FN -11%) trades lower after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Hold, citing the impact to operations from flooding in Thailand and diminished growth prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • CPLA

    Capella Education (CPLA +6.6%) rides an earnings beat higher despite announcing a 36% decline in...

    Capella Education (CPLA +6.6%) rides an earnings beat higher despite announcing a 36% decline in enrollment from last year's comparable. The company says Q4 revenue will dip 3%-4.5% Y/Y on further enrollment losses tied to Capella University, but sees enrollment losses "moderating." Trading on rivals CECO, DV, STRA, and APOL is mixed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • DGX

    Quest Diagnostics (DGX +12.1%) jumps to the top of the S&P leader board after beating Q3 EPS...

    Quest Diagnostics (DGX +12.1%) jumps to the top of the S&P leader board after beating Q3 EPS expectations, raising the low end of its full-year earnings forecast to $4.30/share from $4.25, and boosting its dividend by 70%. News that Surya Mohapatra will step down after seven years as CEO and Chairman prompt speculation that the firm could be a takeover target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • COLM

    Shares of Columbia Sportswear (COLM +7.8%) pop after the firm knocks out a large $0.34 earnings...

    Shares of Columbia Sportswear (COLM +7.8%) pop after the firm knocks out a large $0.34 earnings beat on revenue of $567M (+13% Y/Y). The company reports a spring wholesale backlog of $421M, up 7% from last year. Based on its strong Q3, Columbia raises its outlook for full-year results including an anticipated 15%-16% gain in net sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM

  • Japanese threats about intervention may be put to the test as the dollar falls to a new post-war...

    Japanese threats about intervention may be put to the test as the dollar falls to a new post-war low vs. the yen, touching ¥75.76. It was around this level in March when a coordinated G-7 intervention fried the shorts by sending the dollar to ¥85. Since then, it's been a steady decline back and through the post-earthquake levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS -13.6%) gets hit after its Q3 loss narrowed on an improvement in overall pricing,...

    AK Steel (AKS -13.6%) gets hit after its Q3 loss narrowed on an improvement in overall pricing, but revenue missed due to a drop in flat rolled shipments. Additionally, the company postpones its Q4 outlook, citing economic uncertainty and volatility. The company says it will update guidance later during the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • TNC

    Tennant (NYSE:TNC) shoots 14.4% lower in trading after missing EPS estimates by a penny on...

    Tennant (NYSE:TNC) shoots 14.4% lower in trading after missing EPS estimates by a penny on in-line revenue of $187M (+11% Y/Y). Investors are homing in on the firm's full-year EPS guidance, slashed to a range of $1.54-$1.79, from $1.69-$1.79, on lower revenue expectations.
